  • Changelog

    Compute Awarded economic value across the crisis indicator

    ind_2.Rd

    The indicator focuses on companies that after the emergency outbreak were awarded public contracts much higher in economic value than before the emergency

    Motivation:

    The red flag considers at risk those companies that exceptionally increase their competitive power over the outbreak, in terms of economic value of their awarded contracts on the relevant economic market.

    Scoring Rule

    If Test-statistic significant-> 1, otherwise -> 0

    Main target unit

    This indicator targets Companies

    Usage

    ind_2(
  data,
  contract_value,
  publication_date,
  emergency_name,
  stat_unit,
  test_type
)

    Arguments

    data

    test bndcp data

    contract_value

    Overall Amount of the Tender

    publication_date

    the date in which the tender was published

    emergency_name

    emergency name character string for which you want to evaluate the indicator, e.g. "Coronavirus" "Terremoto Aquila"

    stat_unit

    statistical target unit of measurement, aggregation variable, the indicator target

    test_type

    character vector identifying the type of test you want to execute, alternatives are c("ks", "wilcoxon")

    Value

    indicator schema as from generate_indicator_schema() rows determined by aggregation level and indicator_value based on statistical test performed in ind_2

    See also

    ymd mutate, if_else, group_by, filter, summarise as_factor str_sub nest, drop_na

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
if (interactive()) {
  data("mock_data_core")
  ind_2(
    data = mock_data_core,
    contract_value = importo_complessivo_gara,
    publication_date = data_pubblicazione,
    stat_unit = provincia,
    test_type = "ks",
    emergency_name = "coronavirus"
  )
}
}
